meanings.definition: The whole amount; the entire sum or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The totals of all the numbers is 50.
meanings.sent2: She calculated the totals of her expenses for the month.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the jar, spilling the totals of the coins everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was the totals of his success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of understanding the totals of the lesson.

meanings.definition: To amount to; to add up to.
meanings.sent1: The cost of the items totals to $100.
meanings.sent2: When you totals all the scores, you get the final result.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told totals to a good laugh from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness totals to a warm and welcoming atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The effort he puts in totals to great achievements.

meanings.definition: To bring to a total; to sum up.
meanings.sent1: Please totals the numbers on the list.
meanings.sent2: He totals the expenses before submitting the report.
meanings.sent3: The magician totals his tricks to create a spectacular show.
meanings.sent4: Her love and care totals up to a happy family.
meanings.sent5: The artist totals up the colors to create a beautiful painting.
